alert.note: Alert for Northern Wayne; Pike; Southern Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 4:37AM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch, and snow accumulations of less than one inch. * WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Wayne and Pike counties. In New York, Sullivan, Chenango and Delaware counties. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Tuesday. Precipitation will start off as snow this afternoon, but will mix with and then change to freezing rain by this evening. Spotty freezing rain will then linger overnight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.
